You have a picture made up of $n$ rows and $m$ columns of pixels. Each pixel is either white (".") or black ("#").  Your goal is to change the fewest pixels possible to make the picture look like a barcode.

A barcode picture has these rules:

* Every column must have the same color (all white or all black).
* Each group of continuous columns with the same color must be between $x$ and $y$ columns wide. 

The input will give you the picture and the values for $n$, $m$, $x$, and $y$.  Output the minimum number of pixels you need to change to make the picture a barcode.

You have a rectangular image made of black and white pixels.  Change as few pixels as possible to make it a barcode. A barcode has vertical stripes of the same color, where each stripe is at least a certain width and at most another certain width.
